message.content:
cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.AI, cs.DB, cs.SE. 

The paper deals with a long-standing research problem in logic programming, specifically the treatment of the cut predicate in a logical, high-level way. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Logic in Computer Science (cs.LO) sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes the use of linear logic and choice-disjunctive goal formulas, which are relevant to the Programming Languages (cs.PL) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the semantics of these goals, which could be relevant to the Databases (cs.DB) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a high-level way of specifying mutually exclusive tasks, which could be relevant to the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category.
